decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission No. 224151FUL dated 09/12/2022.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s): 101 rev P1, 102 rev P2, 103 rev P1, 105 rev P1, 120 rev P4, 125 rev P4
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended by the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015, the proposed office shall only be used under Class E (g)(i) and not for any other use without permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To protect the character and amenity of the area and to safeguard the employment land in accordance with 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies D3, D14, E8 of the London Plan, policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021)

| Prior to the commencement of development, a detailed Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The management plan must refer to the following matters:
a)	On-site construction worker parking;
b)	Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site;
c)	Delivery times and booking system (staggered to avoid morning and afternoon school run peak periods);
d)	Site security;
e)	Secure, off-street loading and drop-off facilities, and locations thereof;
f)	Vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including swept path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear;
g)	Locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors' offices;

h)	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents including the name, telephone number and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These contact details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound;
i)	Confirmation of use of Transport for London's Freight Operator Recognition Scheme (FORS) or similar;

j)	Control measures for dust, noise, vibration, lighting, delivery locations, restriction of hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary to 08:00-18:00hrs Mondays to Fridays and 08:00-13:00hrs on Saturdays, and the advance notification to neighbours and other interested parties of proposed works.

Reason: To protect the amenity of occupants and neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policies D14, T4 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| 3 long-stay cycle parking spaces and 1 short-stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development at the front elevation. The long-stay cycle parking spaces shall be within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with all adopted standards prior to the first use of the extension hereby approved. The cycle spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy Ealing's sustainable transport SPD and T5 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (approved plans) seeking to change of the approved roof profile and fenestration of planning permission 224151FUL dated 09/12/2022 for: Two storey side and rear extension to provide additional office space (following demolition of side elevation stairwell); alterations to front elevations involving replacement of front door; installation of two windows.
